Quneitra offensive.Location: Quneitra Governorate and Daraa Governorate, Syria
Quneitra offensive.Result: Rebel victory | Rebels take control of about 80 percent of towns and villages in Quneitra province and seize the Syrian-controlled side of the Golan. | Rebels capture the Quneitra Crossing, ten villages/towns, one base and two strategic hills | Rebels pull back from western Damascus countryside into northern Daraa countryside | Al-Nusra Front takes 45 U.N. peacekeepers hostage on 28 August | (released on 12 September) | Army counter-attack on Mashara repelled.
Quneitra offensive: Part of the Syrian Civil War
Road from Quneitra to Damascus (48690282).jpg | Road from Quneitra to Damascus in the offensive zone (photo taken in 2005)

Belligerents: SRCC | Free Syrian Army | Islamic Front | Al-Nusra Front | Syria | Syrian Arab Republic | Syrian Armed Forces | National Defense Force | United Nations | UNDOF

Strength: Unknown | Unknown | UNDOF: Hundreds | 119-120 | (Quneitra border crossing area)

Casualties and losses: 76+ rebels killed | 71+ Syrian soldiers killed | 11+ captured | 1 Sukhoi Su-24 fighter jet downed by Israel | 44-45 U.N. peacekeepers captured
